channel.title: USPTO All Events
channel.description: This feed provides easy access to USPTO All events.

item.title: Attend DOCX filing training
item.description: Learn how to file patent-related documents in DOCX format using Patent Center and EFS-Web during any of several free upcoming training sessions. You will hear from experts on the United States Patent and Trademark Office's (USPTO) eCommerce Modernization (eMod) team, who will provide demonstrations and answer your questions.

item.title: Intellectual property basics and helpful resources
item.description: Unfamiliar with patents, trademarks, copyrights, and trade secrets? Don't miss this opportunity to learn from United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) experts about intellectual property (IP) basics and potential ways to protect your innovation as you transition from idea to product.

item.title: Intellectual property basics and helpful resources
item.description: Unfamiliar with patents, trademarks, copyrights, and trade secrets? Don't miss this opportunity to learn from United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) experts about intellectual property (IP) basics and potential ways to protect your innovation as you transition from idea to product.

item.title: Intellectual property basics and helpful resources
item.description: Unfamiliar with patents, trademarks, copyrights, and trade secrets? Don't miss this opportunity to learn from United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) experts about intellectual property (IP) basics and potential ways to protect your innovation as you transition from idea to product.

item.title: The Path to a Patent, Part IV: Learn how to draft a patent application
item.description: Understanding patent application drafting is a vital step in protecting your invention. In part four of this eight-part recurring series, United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) experts will discuss the formalities and requirements of drafting a patent application, as well as how to avoid common mistakes. Register now for this free virtual event.

item.title: Intellectual property basics and helpful resources
item.description: Unfamiliar with patents, trademarks, copyrights, and trade secrets? Don't miss this opportunity to learn from United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) experts about intellectual property (IP) basics and potential ways to protect your innovation as you transition from idea to product.

item.title: The Path to a Patent, Part IV: Learn how to draft a patent application
item.description: Understanding patent application drafting is a vital step in protecting your invention. In part four of this eight-part recurring series, United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) experts will discuss the formalities and requirements of drafting a patent application, as well as how to avoid common mistakes. Register now for this free virtual event.

item.title: Trademark Basics Boot Camp, Module 6: Responding to an office action
item.description: Are you a small business owner or entrepreneur interested in learning about trademarks and how to apply for a federal registration? If so, this event is a must-attend. In this sixth module of our eight-part virtual Trademark Basics Boot Camp, we'll focus on responding to office actions, the official letters that USPTO examining attorneys issue after reviewing your trademark application. The event is free, but space is limited, so register early.

item.title: Subject matter eligibility under 35 U.S.C. 101
item.description: Join us on August 9, 2022 for a presentation on patent subject matter eligibility under 35 U.S.C. 101.

item.title: Youth Day for student innovators, creators, and aspiring entrepreneurs

The event is free, but space is limited, so register early.

item.title: Learn about the Request for Comments on Director review, Precedential Opinion Panel Review, and internal circulation and review of Patent Trial and Appeal Board decisions
item.description: On July 20, 2022, the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) published a Federal Register Notice requesting public input on Director review, Precedential Opinion Panel review, and internal circulation and review of Patent Trial and Appeal Board (PTAB) Decisions . Join the next PTAB Boardside Chat webinar for a discussion about the Request for Comments with Vice Chief Administrative Patent Judge Melissa Haapala, Vice Chief Administrative Patent Judge Kalyan Deshpande, and Acting Senior Lead Administrative Patent Judge Amanda Wieker.

Roundtable with USPTO Texas Regional Office and IP attachés for trade organizations
item.description: The United States Patent and Trademark Office's (USPTO) Texas Regional Office and the USPTO Intellectual Property (IP) Attaché Program invite you to a virtual interactive round table discussion. The discussion will feature IP attachés from around the world and employees of the USPTO Texas Regional Office.

item.title: Roundtable with USPTO Texas Regional Office and IP attachés for law schools (law students and staff)
item.description: The United States Patent and Trademark Office's (USPTO) Texas Regional Office and the USPTO Intellectual Property (IP) Attaché Program invite you to a virtual interactive round table discussion. The discussion will feature IP attachés from around the world and members of the USPTO Texas Regional Office.

item.title: Roundtable with USPTO Texas Regional Office and IP attachés for law schools (law students and staff)
item.description: The United States Patent and Trademark Office's (USPTO) Texas Regional Office and the USPTO Intellectual Property (IP) Attaché Program invite you to a virtual interactive round table discussion. The discussion will feature IP attachés from around the world and members of the USPTO Texas Regional Office.

item.title: Blockchain & IP: Cross section of blockchain, patents, and open source
item.description: Join the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) and East Coast Attorney James Gatto to investigate the intersection of blockchain, patents, and open source and the interesting legal issues they present.

item.title: Trademark Basics Boot Camp, Module 7: Keeping your registration alive
item.description: Are you a small business owner or entrepreneur interested in learning about trademarks and how to apply for a federal registration? If so, this event is a must-attend. In this seventh module of our eight-part virtual Trademark Basics Boot Camp, we'll focus on what happens after registration, including mandatory filings to keep your registration alive. The event is free, but space is limited, so register early.

item.title: Blockchain & IP: Cross section of blockchain, patents, and open source
item.description: Join the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) and East Coast Attorney James Gatto to investigate the intersection of blockchain, patents, and open source and the interesting legal issues they present.

item.title: Trademark Basics Boot Camp, Module 7: Keeping your registration alive
item.description: Are you a small business owner or entrepreneur interested in learning about trademarks and how to apply for a federal registration? If so, this event is a must-attend. In this seventh module of our eight-part virtual Trademark Basics Boot Camp, we'll focus on what happens after registration, including mandatory filings to keep your registration alive. The event is free, but space is limited, so register early.

item.title: Attend DOCX filing training
item.description: Learn how to file patent-related documents in DOCX format using Patent Center and EFS-Web during any of several free upcoming training sessions. You will hear from experts on the United States Patent and Trademark Office's (USPTO) eCommerce Modernization (eMod) team, who will provide demonstrations and answer your questions.

item.title: 2022 Patent Public Advisory Committee annual report discussion
item.description: Within 60 days after the end of the fiscal year, the Patent Public Advisory Committee (PPAC) prepares an annual report on the policies, goals, performance, budget, and user fees of the USPTO; transmits the report to the President, the Secretary of Commerce, and the Committees on the Judiciary of the Senate and the House of Representatives; and publishes the report in the Official Gazette. During this meeting, the PPAC members will discuss the preparations and process for producing the annual report.

item.title: Roundtable with USPTO Texas Regional Office and IP attachés for tech transfer, licensing, and commercialization groups
item.description: The United States Patent and Trademark Office's (USPTO) Texas Regional Office and the USPTO Intellectual Property (IP) Attaché Program invite you to a virtual interactive round table discussion. The discussion will feature IP attachés from around the world and employees of the USPTO Texas Regional Office.

item.title: 2022 Patent Public Advisory Committee annual report discussion
item.description: Within 60 days after the end of the fiscal year, the Patent Public Advisory Committee (PPAC) prepares an annual report on the policies, goals, performance, budget, and user fees of the USPTO; transmits the report to the President, the Secretary of Commerce, and the Committees on the Judiciary of the Senate and the House of Representatives; and publishes the report in the Official Gazette. During this meeting, the PPAC members will discuss the preparations and process for producing the annual report.

item.title: Attend DOCX filing training
item.description: Learn how to file patent-related documents in DOCX format using Patent Center and EFS-Web during any of several free upcoming training sessions. You will hear from experts on the United States Patent and Trademark Office's (USPTO) eCommerce Modernization (eMod) team, who will provide demonstrations and answer your questions.

item.title: The Path to a Patent, Part V: Understanding the role of claims in a patent application
item.description: Are you an inventor preparing to file a patent application? In part five of this eight-part recurring series, United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) experts will discuss the parts of the claim, show examples of claim illustrations from issued U.S. patents, and help participants develop a better appreciation of how a patent examiner views a claim. Register now for this free virtual event.

item.title: The Path to a Patent, Part V: Understanding the role of claims in a patent application
item.description: Are you an inventor preparing to file a patent application? In part five of this eight-part recurring series, United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) experts will discuss the parts of the claim, show examples of claim illustrations from issued U.S. patents, and help participants develop a better appreciation of how a patent examiner views a claim. Register now for this free virtual event.

item.title: Roundtable with USPTO Texas Regional Office and IP attachés for bar associates, inn of courts, and law firms
item.description: The United States Patent and Trademark Office's (USPTO) Texas Regional Office and the USPTO Intellectual Property (IP) Attaché Program invite you to a virtual interactive round table discussion. The discussion will feature IP attachés from around the world and employees of the USPTO Texas Regional Office.

item.title: Learn about improving ex parte appeal briefs
item.description: Join the next Patent Trial and Appeal Board (PTAB) Boardside Chat webinar for a discussion about various aspects of ex parte appeal briefs. PTAB Judges LiLan Ren, Bill Baumeister, Linda Gaudette, and Brian Range will present ten ways to improve ex parte appeal briefs and share practice tips with examples for enhancing the arguments presented in your appeal briefs.

item.title: Learn about improving ex parte appeal briefs
item.description: Join the next Patent Trial and Appeal Board (PTAB) Boardside Chat webinar for a discussion about various aspects of ex parte appeal briefs. PTAB Judges LiLan Ren, Bill Baumeister, Linda Gaudette, and Brian Range will present ten ways to improve ex parte appeal briefs and share practice tips with examples for enhancing the arguments presented in your appeal briefs.

item.title: Trademark Basics Boot Camp, Module 8: Question-and-answer panel
item.description: Are you a small business owner or entrepreneur interested in learning about trademarks and how to apply for a federal registration? If so, this event is a must-attend. In this final module of our eight-part virtual Trademark Basics Boot Camp, we'll provide a unique opportunity for you to 'meet the trademark experts.' Come prepared with all of your trademark questions to share with our Law Office Managing Attorneys and other trademark experts. The event is free, but space is limited, so register early.

item.title: Attend DOCX filing training
item.description: Learn how to file patent-related documents in DOCX format using Patent Center and EFS-Web during any of several free upcoming training sessions. You will hear from experts on the United States Patent and Trademark Office's (USPTO) eCommerce Modernization (eMod) team, who will provide demonstrations and answer your questions.

item.title: Trademark Basics Boot Camp, Module 8: Question-and-answer panel
item.description: Are you a small business owner or entrepreneur interested in learning about trademarks and how to apply for a federal registration? If so, this event is a must-attend. In this final module of our eight-part virtual Trademark Basics Boot Camp, we'll provide a unique opportunity for you to 'meet the trademark experts.' Come prepared with all of your trademark questions to share with our Law Office Managing Attorneys and other trademark experts. The event is free, but space is limited, so register early.

item.title: The Path to a Patent, Part VI: Learn how to protect your IP abroad
item.description: Did you know that patents offer territorial rights, meaning that there is no such thing as an international or global patent? Learn how to help protect your intellectual property (IP) in foreign jurisdictions.

item.title: Intellectual property 101
item.description: Do you want to know more about patents, trademarks, copyrights, and trade secrets? Join us for a free, virtual session to learn about intellectual property (IP) basics and potential ways to protect your innovations as you transition from idea to product.

item.title: Intellectual property 101
item.description: Do you want to know more about patents, trademarks, copyrights, and trade secrets? Join us for a free, virtual session to learn about intellectual property (IP) basics and potential ways to protect your innovations as you transition from idea to product.

item.title: Propiedad intelectual 101
item.description: ¿Desea familiarizarse con las patentes, las marcas registradas, los derechos de autor, y los secretos comerciales? De ser así, le invitamos para que aprenda acerca de los fundamentos básicos de la propiedad intelectual (PI) y las formas potenciales de proteger sus innovaciones durante su transición de una idea al producto.

item.title: Patent basics

item.title: Patent basics
item.description: Are you interested in learning about the basics of intellectual property (IP) and patents?

item.title: International agents and attorneys: Learn to think like a patent examiner with STEPP's four-day course - RESCHEDULED
item.description: If you are a United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) registered patent attorney or an agent residing internationally (i.e. outside of the United States), you can get a better understanding of how patent examiners make decisions at the Stakeholder Training on Examination Practice and Procedure (STEPP) agent/attorney four-day course, held from September 13-16, 2022.

item.title: International agents and attorneys: Learn to think like a patent examiner with STEPP's four-day course - RESCHEDULED

item.title: Fundamentos básicos de las patentes
item.description: Si tiene una invención o una idea para un posible producto, no se pierda esta oportunidad. Exploraremos las diferentes clases o tipos de patentes, incluyendo patentes de utilidad, patentes de diseño, y patentes de plantas. Adicionalmente, explicaremos la diferencia y el uso de solicitudes (aplicaciones) de patentes provisionales y no-provisionales.

item.description: Esta sesión es imprescindible para cualquier emprendedor o negocio pequeño interesado en obtener una marca registrada. Exploraremos los tipos diferentes de marcas registradas, incluyendo nombres de las marcas, diseños, logotipos, e imágenes comerciales.

item.description: Unfamiliar with patents, trademarks, copyrights, and trade secrets? Don't miss this opportunity to learn from United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) experts about intellectual property (IP) basics and potential ways to protect your innovation as you transition from idea to product.

item.title: Blockchain & IP: USC 101 patent eligibility in blockchain
item.description: Claims define the boundaries of intellectual property just as property lines define the boundaries of a house. Over the past few years, USC 101 has been clarified regarding patent eligibility as inventions in the digital space because they do not always produce tangible end results.

item.title: Trademark Public Advisory Committee quarterly meeting
item.description: Attend the next quarterly meeting of the United States Patent and Trademark Office's (USPTO) Trademark Public Advisory Committee (TPAC) to learn more about trademark-related policies, goals, performance, budgets, and user fees. The TPAC advises the Under Secretary of Commerce for Intellectual Property and Director of the USPTO. The public meeting agenda will be available one week before the scheduled meeting.

item.title: Trademark Public Advisory Committee quarterly meeting
item.description: Attend the next quarterly meeting of the United States Patent and Trademark Office's (USPTO) Trademark Public Advisory Committee (TPAC) to learn more about trademark-related policies, goals, performance, budgets, and user fees. The TPAC advises the Under Secretary of Commerce for Intellectual Property and Director of the USPTO. The public meeting agenda will be available one week before the scheduled meeting.

item.title: Blockchain & IP: Stakeholder spotlight
item.description: Hear about the innovations and inventions in supply chain management, credit cards, insurance, and banking that companies along the United States Eastern seaboard are pursuing. These real-world use cases will delight and inspire your outlook of the future.
